00209 class EGS_CDGEOMETRY_EXPORT EGS_CDGeometry : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00210 
00211 public:
00212 
00213     EGS_CDGeometry(EGS_BaseGeometry *G1, EGS_BaseGeometry **G,
00214                    const string &Name = "", int indexing=0) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
00215         nmax = 0;
00216         new_indexing = false;
00217         reg_to_base = 0;
00218         local_start = 0;
00219         nbase = G1->regions();
00220         g = new EGS_BaseGeometry* [nbase];
00221         bg = G1; //bg->ref();
00222         for (int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00223             g[j] = G[j];
00224             if (g[j]) {
00225                 //g[j]->ref();
00226                 int n = g[j]->regions();
00227                 if (n > nmax) {
00228                     nmax = n;
00229                 }
00230             }
00231         }
00232         if (!nmax) {
00233             nmax = 1;
00234         }
00235         nreg = nbase*nmax;
00236         is_convex = false;
00237         if (indexing) {
00238             setUpIndexing();
00239         }
00240         setHasRhoScaling();
00241     };
00242 
00243     EGS_CDGeometry(EGS_BaseGeometry *G1, const vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> &G,
00244                    const string &Name = "",int indexing=0) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
00245         if (!G1) egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry: got a null pointer to the"
00246                               " base geometry?\n");
00247         nbase = G1->regions();
00248         new_indexing = false;
00249         reg_to_base = 0;
00250         local_start = 0;
00251         if (nbase != G.size()) egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry: number of passed"
00252                                             " geometries (%d) is not the same as the number of regions (%d)\n",
00253                                             nbase,G.size());
00254         nmax = 0;
00255         g = new EGS_BaseGeometry* [nbase];
00256         bg = G1; //bg->ref();
00257         for (int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00258             g[j] = G[j];
00259             if (g[j]) {
00260                 //g[j]->ref();
00261                 int n = g[j]->regions();
00262                 if (n > nmax) {
00263                     nmax = n;
00264                 }
00265             }
00266         }
00267         if (!nmax) {
00268             nmax = 1;
00269         }
00270         nreg = nbase*nmax;
00271         is_convex = false;
00272         if (indexing) {
00273             setUpIndexing();
00274         }
00275         setHasRhoScaling();
00276     };

00278 
00279     ~EGS_CDGeometry() {
00280         for (int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00281             if (g[j]) {
00282                 if (!g[j]->deref()) {
00283                     delete g[j];
00284                 }
00285             }
00286         }
00287         delete [] g;
00288         if (!bg->deref()) {
00289             delete bg;
00290         }
00291         if (new_indexing) {
00292             if (reg_to_base) {
00293                 delete [] reg_to_base;
00294             }
00295             if (local_start) {
00296                 delete [] local_start;
00297             }
00298         }
00299     };
00300 
00301     int medium(int ireg) const {
00302         /*
00303         int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00304         if( g[ibase] ) return g[ibase]->medium(ireg-ibase*nmax);
00305         return bg->medium(ibase);
00306         */
00307         int ibase, ilocal;
00308         if (new_indexing) {
00309             ibase = reg_to_base[ireg];
00310             ilocal = ireg - local_start[ibase];
00311         }
00312         else {
00313             ibase = ireg/nmax;
00314             ilocal = ireg-ibase*nmax;
00315         }
00316         return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->medium(ilocal) : bg->medium(ibase);
00317     };
00318 
00319     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00320         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
00321             return false;
00322         }
00323         int ibase, icd;
00324         if (new_indexing) {
00325             ibase = reg_to_base[ireg];
00326             icd = ireg-local_start[ibase];
00327         }
00328         else {
00329             ibase = ireg/nmax;
00330             icd = ireg - ibase*nmax;
00331         }
00332         return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->isRealRegion(icd) :
00333                bg->isRealRegion(ibase);
00334     };
00335 
00336     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00337         int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00338         if (ibase < 0) {
00339             return false;
00340         }
00341         if (g[ibase]) {
00342             return g[ibase]->isInside(x);
00343         }
00344         return true;
00345     };
00346 
00347     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00348         int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00349         if (ibase < 0) {
00350             return ibase;
00351         }
00352         int ir = 0;
00353         if (g[ibase]) {
00354             ir = g[ibase]->isWhere(x);
00355             if (ir < 0) {
00356                 return ir;
00357             }
00358         }
00359         return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + ir : ibase*nmax + ir;
00360     };
00361 
00362     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00363         return isWhere(x);
00364     };
00365 
00366     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00367                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
00368         if (ireg >= 0) {
00369             //
00370             // *** We are inside and ibase is the current base geometry
00371             //     region and icd the local region of the geometry inscribed
00372             //     in ibase (if any)
00373             int ibase, icd;
00374             if (new_indexing) {
00375                 ibase = reg_to_base[ireg];
00376                 icd = ireg-local_start[ibase];
00377             }
00378             else {
00379                 ibase = ireg/nmax;
00380                 icd = ireg - ibase*nmax;
00381             }
00382             //
00383             // *** See if we will hit a boundary in the base geometry.
00384             //     If we do, newmed and normal will get set accordingly.
00385             //
00386             int ibase_new = bg->howfar(ibase,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00387             if (g[ibase]) {
00388                 //
00389                 // *** There is another geometry in this base geometry region.
00390                 //     See if will hit one of its boundaries first.
00391                 //
00392                 int icd_new = g[ibase]->howfar(icd,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00393                 if (icd_new < 0) {
00394                     return icd_new;
00395                 }
00396                 // above: yes we do but the new region is outside
00397                 // => we exit the entire geometry. newmed and normal
00398                 // must have been set accordingly.
00399                 if (icd_new != icd)
00400                     return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd_new :
00401                            ibase*nmax + icd_new;
00402                 // above: yes we do and we enter the local region icd_new
00403                 // => calculate the new region and return
00404                 // newmed and normal must have been set in g[ibase]->howfar
00405             }
00406             if (ibase_new != ibase) {
00407                 // we have entered a new base geometry region.
00408                 if (ibase_new < 0) {
00409                     return ibase_new;
00410                 }
00411                 // but this region is outside => just return.
00412                 if (g[ibase_new]) {
00413                     // there is a geometry in this new base geometry region.
00414                     // are we already inside?
00415                     EGS_Vector tmp(x + u*t);
00416                     int icd_new = g[ibase_new]->isWhere(tmp);
00417                     if (icd_new < 0) {
00418                         return icd_new;
00419                     }
00420                     // above: no, we are not => we exit the entire geometry.
00421                     // below: yes, we are in local region icd_new
00422                     // simply calculate the new global region and return
00423                     // newmed and normal have been set in bg->howfar above
00424                     if (newmed) {
00425                         *newmed = g[ibase_new]->medium(icd_new);
00426                     }
00427                     return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase_new] + icd_new :
00428                            ibase_new*nmax + icd_new;
00429                 }
00430                 // there is no cd geometry in this base geometry region
00431                 // => simply calculate the new global region and return
00432                 // newmed and normal have been set in bg->howfar above
00433                 return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase_new] : ibase_new*nmax;
00434             }
00435             // new region is the same as old region (i.e. we don't reach
00436             // a boundary => simply return the old region.
00437             return ireg;
00438         }
00439 
00440         //
00441         // *** If here, we are outside.
00442         //     Are we already inside the base geometry ?
00443         //
00444         int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00445         EGS_Float tb=0, ttot=0;
00446         bool first_time = true;// first time checking base geometry?
00447         EGS_Vector n;
00448         int mednew;
00449         EGS_Vector *pn = normal ? &n : 0;
00450         int *pmednew = newmed ? &mednew : 0;
00451         if (ibase >= 0) {
00452             //
00453             // IK Feb 22 2007:
00454             // The following seems flawed. Yes, if there is no inscribed
00455             // geometry we can assume that ibase>=0 is due to roundoff,
00456             // but if there is, we might as well be about to enter this
00457             // geometry (but isInside() thinks that we are already inside).
00458             // What would be the best way to check? Don't know yet.
00459             //
00460             // already inside the base geometry.
00461             // unfortunately, due to roundoff we may think that
00462             // we are inside the base geometry but we are actually
00463             // outside. To make the logic below work, we need to
00464             // check if we are inside the geometry inscribed in region
00465             // ibase.
00466             int icd = g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->isWhere(x) : 0;
00467             if (icd >= 0) {
00468 
00469                 // We think we are outside, but isWhere(x) reports that we are
00470                 // inside. This can be caused by numerical roundoff.
00471                 // There are 2 possibilities:
00472                 //   a) The particle has just left geometry, but due to roundoff
00473                 //      we still find it inside for the next step. This possibility
00474                 //      can be checked by checking the distance to the exit point
00475                 //   b) The particle is approaching the geometry but due to roundoff
00476                 //      we already find it inside. This possibility can be checked
00477                 //      by determining the distance to exit point moving along the
00478                 //      direction oposite to the particle direction.
00479                 //***********************************************************************
00480                 // EMH April 12 2013: Check 0 for (b) below was ambiguosly defined as there
00481                 // will be situations where u and -u will not hit the geometry. An univocally
00482                 // defined test is to check whether particle actually enters the geometry from
00483                 // the boundary or a location near it (round-off).
00484                 // REMEMBER: - isWhere will return ir >= 0 when particle seats at a boundary.
00485                 //           - We are here either due to roundoff or just at the boundary
00486                 //
00487                 // 0. Proper check for a and b)
00488                 int ixold = new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd :
00489                             ibase*nmax + icd;
00490                 //EGS_Float tb_neg = 1e30; int ixnew_neg = howfar(ixold,x,u*(-1),tb_neg,0,pn);
00491                 //EGS_Float tb_pos = 1e30; int ixnew_pos = howfar(ixold,x,u,tb_pos,0,pn);
00492                 // Call to CD geometry howfar with updated region ixold. If it is aimed away from
00493                 // geometry, it will return ixnew = -1 and assumption a) was correct. If it is
00494                 // aimed into geometry, it will return ixnew >=0 and assumption b) was correct.
00495                 tb = 1e30;
00496                 int ixnew = howfar(ixold,x,u,tb,0,pn);
00497                 // Enters geometry and at a boundary or very close to one.
00498                 //if( ixnew_pos >= 0 && ixnew_neg < 0 && tb_neg <= epsilon && tb_pos <= epsilon) {
00499                 if (ixnew >= 0 && tb <= epsilon) {                             // (b) is true
00500                     t = 0;
00501                     if (newmed) *newmed = g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->medium(icd) :
00502                                               bg->medium(ibase);
00503                     //if( normal ) *normal = (*pn)*(-1);
00504                     if (normal) {
00505                         *normal = *pn;
00506                     }
00507                     return ixold;
00508                 }
00509                 else if (ixnew < 0 && tb <= epsilon) {                         // (a) is true
00510                     return ixnew;
00511                 }
00512                 //***********************************************************************
00513 
00514                 // 1. Check if we exit the base geometry after a sufficiently small
00515                 // distance.
00516                 EGS_Float t1=1e30, t2 = 1e30;
00517                 int ibase_n, ic_n=0;
00518                 ibase_n = bg->howfar(ibase,x,u,t1);
00519                 if (ibase_n < 0 && t1 < 1e-4) {
00520                     // Yes we do => we assume that it was a roundoff problem
00521                     // and in reality the particle was outside the base geometry.
00522                     // We then check if it will enter the base geometry.
00523                     EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t1);
00524                     tb = t-t1;
00525                     ibase = bg->howfar(ibase_n,xtmp,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00526                     if (ibase_n < 0) {
00527                         return ibase_n;    // no, so just return.
00528                     }
00529                     // yes, so transport to entry point and follow normal outside logic
00530                     tb += t1;
00531                     ttot = tb;
00532                     ibase = ibase_n;
00533                     first_time = false;
00534                     goto do_checks;
00535                 }
00536                 // If here, particle is inside base geometry and also doesn't exit base geometry
00537                 // very soon. So, we must do check 2.:
00538                 // 2. Check if we exit the inscribed geometry after a sufficiently small
00539                 // distance.
00540                 if (g[ibase]) {
00541                     ic_n = g[ibase]->howfar(icd,x,u,t2);
00542                     if (ic_n < 0 && t2 < 1e-4) {
00543                         // Yes we do => we assume that it was a roundoff problem
00544                         // and in reality the particle was outside the inscribed geometry.
00545                         // We move to the boundary and check again the base geometry.
00546                         EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t2);
00547                         ibase = bg->isWhere(xtmp);
00548                         if (ibase < 0) {
00549                             tb = t - t2;
00550                             ibase = bg->howfar(ibase,xtmp,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00551                             if (ibase < 0) {
00552                                 return ibase;
00553                             }
00554                             tb += t2;
00555                             ttot = tb;
00556                             first_time = false;
00557                         }
00558                         else {
00559                             tb = t2;
00560                             ttot = tb;
00561                         }
00562                         goto do_checks;
00563                     }
00564                 }
00565                 if (t1 < 1e-4 && ibase_n >= 0 && g[ibase_n]) {
00566                     // last resort.
00567                     EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t1);
00568                     int icdx = g[ibase_n]->isWhere(xtmp);
00569                     if (icdx < 0) {
00570                         tb = t1;
00571                         ttot = tb;
00572                         ibase = ibase_n;
00573                         first_time = true;
00574                         goto do_checks;
00575                     }
00576                 }
00577                 if (t1 > 1e-3 && t2 > 1e-3) {
00578                     error_flag = 1;
00579                     egsWarning("EGS_CDGeometry::howfar: ireg<0, but position appears inside\n");
00580                     egsWarning(" name=%s base name=%s inscribed name=%s\n",name.c_str(),
00581                                bg->getName().c_str(),g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->getName().c_str() : "none");
00582                     egsWarning(" x=(%g,%g,%g) u=(%g,%g,%g) ibase=%d icd=%d\n",
00583                                x.x,x.y,x.z,u.x,u.y,u.z,ibase,icd);
00584                     egsWarning(" distance to boundaries: base=(%d,%g) inscribed=(%d,%g)\n",
00585                                ibase_n,t1,ic_n,t2);
00586                 }
00587             }
00588             if (icd >= 0) {
00589                 return ireg;
00590             }
00591             tb = 0;
00592             ttot = 0;
00593         } // yes, we are.
00594         else {
00595             // no, we are not. Check if we will enter the base geometry.
00596             first_time = false;
00597             tb = t;
00598             ibase = bg->howfar(ireg,x,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00599             if (ibase < 0) {
00600                 return ibase;    // no, we will not.
00601             }
00602             ttot = tb; // i.e. we enter the base geometry after a
00603             // path-length of tb (wich is less than t).
00604             // if this happens, newmed and normal are set
00605             // by the bg->howfar call.
00606         }
00607 
00608 do_checks:
00609         EGS_Vector tmp(x + u*tb);  // position at which we are inside
00610         // the base geometry
00611         while (1) {
00612             if (!g[ibase]) { // no inscribed geometry in this base geometry region
00613                 t = ttot;
00614                 if (newmed) {
00615                     *newmed = mednew;
00616                 }
00617                 if (normal) {
00618                     *normal = n;
00619                 }
00620                 return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] : ibase*nmax;
00621             }
00622             // => we have entered.
00623             int icd = -1;
00624             if (!first_time) { // already howfar-checked base geometry
00625                 icd = g[ibase]->isWhere(tmp);
00626                 if (icd >= 0) {
00627                     // already inside of the geometry of this base geometry
00628                     // region.
00629                     t = ttot;
00630                     if (newmed) {
00631                         *newmed = g[ibase]->medium(icd);
00632                     }
00633                     if (normal) {
00634                         *normal = n;
00635                     }
00636                     return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd :
00637                            ibase*nmax + icd;
00638                 }
00639                 first_time = false;
00640             }
00641 
00642             // see if we will enter a new base geometry region before t
00643             EGS_Float tnew = t - ttot;
00644             int ibase_new = bg->howfar(ibase,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00645             // see if we will enter the cd geometry of this base geometry
00646             // region.
00647             int icd_new = g[ibase]->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00648             if (icd_new >= 0) {
00649                 // yes, we will.
00650                 t = ttot + tnew;
00651                 if (newmed) {
00652                     *newmed = mednew;
00653                 }
00654                 if (normal) {
00655                     *normal = n;
00656                 }
00657                 return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd_new :
00658                        ibase*nmax + icd_new;
00659             }
00660             // if the base region is the same or we have exited the
00661             // base geometry, the particle never enters.
00662 
00663             //if( ibase_new == ibase || ibase_new < 0 ) return -1;
00664             if (ibase_new == ibase) {
00665                 return -1;
00666             }
00667             if (ibase_new < 0) {
00668                 tmp += u*tnew;
00669                 ttot += tnew;
00670                 tnew = t - ttot;
00671                 ibase_new = bg->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00672                 if (ibase_new < 0) {
00673                     return -1;
00674                 }
00675                 //tb = tnew; ttot += tnew; first_time = false;
00676                 //goto do_checks;
00677             }
00678             // OK, we are in a new base geometry now, adjust
00679             // position and path-length so-far and retry.
00680             if (tnew < 1e-6) {
00681                 tnew = 1e-6;
00682             }
00683             tmp += u*tnew;
00684             ttot += tnew;
00685             ibase = ibase_new;
00686             first_time = false;
00687         }
00688     };
00689 
00690     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00691         if (ireg >= 0) {
00692             int ibase, icd;
00693             if (new_indexing) {
00694                 ibase = reg_to_base[ireg];
00695                 icd = ireg - local_start[ibase];
00696             }
00697             else {
00698                 ibase = ireg/nmax;
00699                 icd = ireg - ibase*nmax;
00700             }
00701             EGS_Float t = bg->hownear(ibase,x);
00702             if (!g[ibase] || t <= 0) {
00703                 return t;
00704             }
00705             EGS_Float t1 = g[ibase]->hownear(icd,x);
00706             return (t1 < t ? t1 : t);
00707         }
00708         int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00709         if (ibase < 0) {
00710             EGS_Float tt = bg->hownear(ireg,x);
00711             return tt;
00712         }
00713         EGS_Float t = bg->hownear(ibase,x);
00714         if (g[ibase]) {
00715             EGS_Float t1 = g[ibase]->hownear(-1,x);
00716             if (t1 < t) {
00717                 t = t1;
00718             }
00719         }
00720         return t;
00721     };
00722 
00723     int getMaxStep() const {
00724         int nstep = 0;
00725         for (int j=0; j<bg->regions(); ++j) {
00726             if (g[j]) {
00727                 nstep += g[j]->getMaxStep();
00728             }
00729             else {
00730                 ++nstep;
00731             }
00732         }
00733         return nstep + 1;
00734     }
00735 
00736     bool hasBooleanProperty(int ireg, EGS_BPType prop) const {
00737         if (ireg >= 0 && ireg < nreg) {
00738             int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00739             return g[ibase] ?
00740                    g[ibase]->hasBooleanProperty(ireg - ibase*nmax,prop) :
00741                    bg->hasBooleanProperty(ibase,prop);
00742         }
00743         return false;
00744     };
00745     void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType) {
00746         setPropertError("setBooleanProperty()");
00747     };
00748     void addBooleanProperty(int) {
00749         setPropertError("addBooleanProperty()");
00750     };
00751     void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType,int,int,int step=1) {
00752         setPropertError("setBooleanProperty()");
00753     };
00754     void addBooleanProperty(int,int,int,int step=1) {
00755         setPropertError("addBooleanProperty()");
00756     };
00757 
00758     const string &getType() const {
00759         return type;
00760     };
00761 
00762     void  setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00763     void  setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00764     EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00765         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nbase*nmax) {
00766             return 1;
00767         }
00768         int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00769         return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->getRelativeRho(ireg-ibase*nmax) :
00770                bg->getRelativeRho(ibase);
00771     };
00772 
00773     virtual void getLabelRegions(const string &str, vector<int> &regs);
00774 
00775 protected:
00776 
00777     EGS_BaseGeometry *bg;
00778     EGS_BaseGeometry **g;
00779     int              nbase, nmax;
00780     static string    type;
00781 
00782     /* New indexing style:
00783 
00784        If the base geometry has \f$N_B\f$ regions and the inscribed
00785        geometries \f$G_j\f$ have \f$n_j\f$ regions, then the CD geometry
00786        will have \f$n_1 + n_2 + \cdots n_{N_B}\f$ regions
00787        (if there is no inscribed geometry is some region, then
00788        \f$n_j = 1\f$). Then, for a CD geometry region \f$i\f$
00789        the base region \f$i_B\f$ is given by reg_to_base[i] and
00790        the local region in the inscribed geometry (if any) is
00791        \f$i\f$ - local_start[\f$i_B\f$].
00792      */
00793 
00795     bool             new_indexing;
00798     int              *reg_to_base;
00801     int              *local_start;
00802 
00803     void setMedia(EGS_Input *inp, int, const int *);
00804 
00805 private:
00806 
00807     void setPropertError(const char *funcname) {
00808         egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry::%s: don't use this method\n  Define "
00809                  "properties in the constituent geometries instead\n");
00810     };
00811 
00812     void setHasRhoScaling() {
00813         has_rho_scaling = false;
00814         if (bg->hasRhoScaling()) {
00815             has_rho_scaling = true;
00816             return;
00817         }
00818         for (int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00819             if (g[j]) {
00820                 if (g[j]->hasRhoScaling()) {
00821                     has_rho_scaling = true;
00822                     return;
00823                 }
00824             }
00825         }
00826     };
00827 
00828     void setUpIndexing();
00829 };
